the meaning of the second verse furthermore maharaj parikshit was always consciously
surrounded to the personality of godhead and therefore he was neither afraid nor overwhelmed
by fear due to a snake bird which was to bite him because he was afraid of him andí”—
of the fury of a brahmana boy. Before describing the details of Pariksit being cursed by a brahmana
boy for an untimely death due to the curse being bitten by a snake bird, Suta Goswami is telling
the sage Nami Sharanya that Pariksit Maharaj was not afraid of death itself, what to speak of fear
of death due to a curse being bitten by a snake bird, he had no fear at all. Why? Because he is
always surrendered to the personality of Godhead Krishna. So in the purport Srila Prabhupada explains
this point. A self-surrendered devotee of the Lord is called Narayana,
Narayana, Parayana. One is completely surrendered to the Supreme Lord Narayana
and is very much attached to the Lord. Such a person is never afraid of any place or person,
not even of death. Only a pure devotee of the Supreme Lord is fearless in this material
existence. Otherwise in the material existence there are always these four
right components, one is a pure devotee of the Lord and one is a pure devotee of the Lord.
So Nami Sharanya is telling us that the pure devotee of the Lord is fearlessness in this material existence. Otherwise in the material existence there are always these four
fundamental problems which simply are giving so much of miseries to the living
entities. Janma, Mrtyu, Jara, Vyadi, Dukha, Dosha, Anudarshanam, Krishna warns about
this in the 13th chapter of the Bhagavad Gita. Material existence means these four
fundamental Dukha, Dosha. Dukha means misery and Dosha means defect. So, nobody can avoid
these four things. Once they take birth in this material world, they have to face death
at a later time. And in between birth and death, there are the miseries of disease and
old age. But a person who is completely surrendered to the Supreme Lord,
like Maharaj Pariksit, is never afraid of any misery or any person or any situation,
not at all. He is fearless. For him, that means for such a surrendered soul,
nothing is as important as the Supreme Lord. Thus, he gives equal importance to heaven and hell.
Why? How is it possible?
That a surrendered devotee of the Supreme Lord, how does he give equal importance to heaven and hell?
There is so much difference in the conditions of living in heaven and hell.
The reason is, he knows well that both heaven and hell are creations of the Lord.
Who is the creator of this material existence?
The different planetary systems, the different arrangements, the different facilities.
It is Supreme Lord himself.
He is the original creator.
There are secondary creators,
but the original creator is the Supreme Lord.
And similarly, life and death are different conditions of existence created by the Lord in this material world.
It is an arrangement of the Supreme Lord
that those living entities
who are rebellious
to death,
devotional service, who are rebellious and who don't want to live with the Supreme Lord
in the spiritual kingdom of God, they are placed in material existence and they are
placed in situation of life and death, heaven and hell, etc.
But in all conditions and in all circumstances in this material world, remembrance of Narayana
is essential if at all somebody wants to be fearless, somebody wants protection, somebody
wants to avoid suffering from these conditions.
What is most essential and what works really ultimately is
the remembrance of Narayana.
Constant remembrance of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Narayana.
The Narayana Parayana practices this constantly.
A pure devotee like Maharaj Pariksit, he practices remembering Narayana constantly.
Maharaj Pariksit was such a pure devotee.
He was wrongfully cursed by an inexperienced son of a brahmana.
He was wrongfully cursed by an inexperienced son of a brahmana.
This son of the brahmana was under the influence of Kali. Therefore, he wrongly cursed Parikshit Maharaj. And details will be described in the later part of this chapter by Suta Goswami.
But here Prabhupada is just explaining how Parikshit was not afraid of death or the curse or the bite of this snake bird by which he was supposed to die. He was not afraid of that.

So, Maharaj Parikshit took this curse to be sent by Narayana. How is it possible for Parikshit to consider like this? He knew that Narayana, Lord Krishna had saved him when he was burned in the womb of his mother.
How did Parikshit take birth? When he was in the womb of his mother.
At the end of the battle of Kurukshetra, this Dronacharya's son Ashwatthama was fighting on the side of the Kauravas and the Kauravas had lost the battle.
So, he wanted to somehow take revenge against the Kauravas losing the battle.
So, he tried to kill them.
He tried to kill the five Pandavas and by mistake he killed the five sons of the five Pandavas, Upapandavas and by beheading them when they were asleep, fast asleep.
And this was not at all appreciated by Duryodhana, his master.
Duryodhana condemned this heinous act by Ashwatthama.
And then Ashwatthama was actually punished by Arjuna.
Though his life was spared.
And then he still was not, was not still giving up the opportunity to do some harm, some destruction for the Pandavas.
So, what did he do?
He used a Brahmastra to kill the only surviving descendant of the Pandavas who was Maharaj Parikshit.
In the womb of his mother, the grandson of Arjuna, in the womb of his mother, Abhimanyu's wife, Arjuna's daughter-in-law.
So, he tried to kill Parikshit in the womb of his mother.
But Parikshit was saved by Krishna when this danger was there.
So, Parikshit knew that he was saved by the Supreme Lord Narayana or Lord Krishna when he was in the womb of his mother.
And similarly, if he were to be killed by a snake bite, it would also take place by the will of the Lord.
So, the devotee never goes against the will of the Lord.
Anything sent by God is a blessing for the devotee.
So, devotee is completely surrendered to the Lord.
His life is in the hands of the Lord.
Nobody else can do anything without the Lord's sanction in the material world.
Therefore, Maharaj Parikshit was neither afraid nor bewildered by such things as a curse or bite of a snake bird or death itself.
That is the sign of a pure devotee of the Lord.
A pure devotee is always fearless.
He is always protected.
He is always under the shelter of the Supreme Lord.
And in this way, he is actually indifferent to all material situations and circumstances.
I will stop here.
Thank you very much.
Hare Krishna.
